# Scale: Melodic in G (Mode: Lydian augmented, Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
The Melodic scale in G, also known as the Mode of Lydian augmented, with the shape of E, is a unique and exotic scale that can add a rich and colorful sound to your music. This scale is derived from the G major scale with the sharp fourth and sharp fifth notes. It has an interesting and mystical quality that can create a sense of tension and suspense in your compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
The notes in the Melodic scale in G (Mode: Lydian augmented, Shape: E) are as follows:
- G (Root)
- A (Major 2nd)
- B (Major 3rd)
- D# (Augmented 4th/Diminished 5th)
- E# (Augmented 5th/Minor 6th)
- F# (Major 6th)
- A# (Major 7th)

The intervals in this scale are Root - Major 2nd - Major 3rd - Augmented 4th/Diminished 5th - Augmented 5th/Minor 6th - Major 6th - Major 7th.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Melodic scale in G (Mode: Lydian augmented, Shape: E) can be used in various genres to create a mystical and exotic flavor in the music. It is often found in genres like fusion jazz, progressive rock, and experimental music where musicians want to add an element of tension and intrigue to their compositions. This scale can evoke a sense of mystery and otherworldliness, making it a favorite choice for musicians looking to explore new sonic territories.
